title: Rates of Change - rate of ROC interpretation

content.question: <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math><math alttext="11"><mn>11</mn></math>Distance (meters)<math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="9"><mn>9</mn></math><math alttext="21"><mn>21</mn></math><math alttext="41"><mn>41</mn></math> ​An object is moving in a straight line from a starting point. The distance, in meters, from the starting point at selected times, in seconds, is given in the table. If the pattern is consistent, which of the following statements about the rate of change of the rates of change of distance over time is true?

choices.label: ​The rate of change of the rates of change is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> meters per second, and the object is neither speeding up nor slowing down.
​The rate of change of the rates of change is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> meters per second per second, and the object is neither speeding up nor slowing down.
​The rate of change of the rates of change is <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> meters per second, and the object is neither speeding up nor slowing down.
​The rate of change of the rates of change is <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> meters per second per second, and the object is speeding up.

content.answer: ​The rate of change of the rates of change is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> meters per second per second, and the object is neither speeding up nor slowing down.
